intro: Pilosella heteromelana subsp. heteromelana, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe, this species thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in open meadows and mountainous areas. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to related species.
